  • Method Details

    • getKeyByValue

      private static <T,​ E> T getKeyByValue​(@NotNull java.util.Map<T,​E> map, E value)

    • deregisterConnection

      public void deregisterConnection​(ClientConnection c)
      The function deregister a Clientconnection from the Server. It checks if it's necessary to close connections also for other clients in the game.

      This is called only when a player QUIT/DISCONNECT the game

      Parameters:
      c - Clientconnection of the client who need to be deregister

    • deregisterConnectionSingleClient

      public void deregisterConnectionSingleClient​(ClientConnection c)
      This is called when we need to deregister a player. For the QUIT case see deregisterConnection

      The function deregister a single client, and check if he was playing a 2 or 3 playerGame

      Case 2 Remove from Map for 2 player c

      Case 3 Same as for Case 2. In addition since there are 2 players left, move the 2 left players, from Map for 3 to Map for 2

      Parameters:
      c - ClientConnection of the client who need to be deregister
      See Also:
      deregisterConnection(it.polimi.ingsw.server.ClientConnection)

    • addClient

      public boolean addClient​(ClientConnection c, java.lang.String name)
      Add a new client in the waiting List, checking previously if the name was already taken, by a client registered before
      Parameters:
      c - ClientConnection of the client
      name - Name chosen by the client
      Returns:
      true if the client was successfully added to the waiting list, false otherwise

    • isFirstPlayer

      protected boolean isFirstPlayer​(ClientConnection c)
      Check if the client is the first in the registerOrder List.

      Parameters:
      c - ClientConnection
      Returns:
      true if the client is first in registerOrder, false otherwise

    • manageLobby

      protected boolean manageLobby​(int numberOfPlayers)
      Check if there are enough clients in the waiting List to start a new game and in this case start it.

      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - Parameter received by the master player (not master player pass only "-1" for default)
      Returns:
      true if there are enough player to start a game, false otherwise

    • createGame

      private void createGame​(int numberOfPlayers)
      The function create a new Lobby for the players, creating the MVC components and starting the interaction with the players

      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - who will play this game. The number is chosen by the master player

    • run

      public void run()
